website_summaries.verdict: The Ride 9 is Saucony’s go-to versatile trainer that juggles responsive cushioning, flexibility, support, and smooth transitions in one go. Saucony tweaked some of the things in the latest version of the Ride to give a smoother and more responsive feel than the past instalment. It is light enough for up-tempo runs or for marathon racing, but delivers enough cushioning for everyday running. Several experts are already tipping it to be one of the best trainers of the year.
pros: The Saucony Ride 9 impressed most of the reviewers where comfort is concerned
Many runners consider the price as well worth the investment
It is lighter than the earlier model
The new Tri-Flex outsole enhances ground contact and flexibility
Saucony adds the Everun as the top sole for more consistency in the cushioning
A good number of runners appreciated the superb traction from this shoe
It is available in narrow and wide widths
It has excellent support, according to a handful
Durability is not compromised despite being a relatively lightweight shoe, according to several testers
It is a versatile shoe that can handle almost all types of distances under different speeds
Breathability is another strong point of the Ride 9
cons: The fit is a bit narrow, based on some runners’ observations
Some runners noticed that it runs a bit small
A moderate number of Saucony Ride fans were hugely disappointed that the spirit and performance of this well-liked shoe are no longer around in this latest version
Some loyal fans of the Ride were upset that the shoe can no longer accommodate their orthotics

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart on second use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes before. They were amazing for running. These shoes are lightweight, neutral pronation, and great cushion. Unfortunately this specific pair I bought lost it's tread on second run in them. The bottom of the shoe literally fell apart. Leaving me on an embarrassed uneven walk home. I'll try to see if the return process works out. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: TwoDawgs

customer_reviews.title: Typical Saucony.  1/2 size to small and a narrow toe box.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Saucony's prior to being a Brooks person. These shoes were on sale so I thought I would try them again since I haven't been in Saucony's in about 6 years. I knew enough to purchase a 1/2 size larger, which I am glad I did. The issue for me with Saucony vs Brooks is two fold. First, I find the toe box to be too narrow. Downside to that is purchasing a wide shoe and the toe box is too wide. Second, the padding isn't what you would expect for a comfortable ride. These perform more like a corrective shoe in my opinion. I ended up sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa H

customer_reviews.title: Great Saucony shoe, Amazon and RUNNINGDOG did a go job to make my full refund easy for the defective product
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony shoe selector program worked great. Limited miles in the last 15 years, ran in Saucony lots of mikes before the job and family reduced my miles. These are great!!! No leg pain or soreness from the shoes.. never used an 8mm before, find that it provides for a good kinematic and stride. Lightweight yet provide confidence on 5 mile trail runs on Saturday and Sunday's, stable motion control and support. Update, after 5 months the sole delaminated from the right an left shoe. Seems to be specific to the red colored tread, several other posting with the same failure. Amazon and RUNNINGDOG made a full refund, but I had to pay the return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for me and helped with my knee pain
customer_reviews.text: I have had 6 pairs of these shoes over the years. They are perfect for me and the running I do. Before I found these shoes and had a proper fitting done, I had a lot of knee problems. Went away with these! Sad they are discontinued. I’ve bought a few extra pairs to put in the closet. I hear the ride 10 is god also, but I’ll stick with what I know for as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: ... and replaced them with the same because I have liked them so well
customer_reviews.text: They fit me "as expected" because I already owned a pair and replaced them with the same because I have liked them so well. That said, depending on brand/style of shoes, I wear 11.5 or 12.0, regular width. A 12.0 works best with these. My feet are slightly narrow, but these snug up and fit great. Great cushioning without being too "squishy". If you have a neutral stride (no pronation issues) and tend to put your heel down first, these shoes should work well for you. I don't run competitively and only put in about 25 miles or so per week on paved surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Ed

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ride indeed, feels a little longer in length though to my Ride 8's.
customer_reviews.text: I'll never understand why these brands change the overall fit of a shoe they release perennially. I get changing the "upper" style, colors and new materials in the footbed, but the actual size should stay consistent IMHO. They do fit pretty well compared to my Ride 8's, but these are just plain longer in length. Not necessarily a roomier toe box, just longer. It was an easy fix, I had a new pair of Sof Sole Athletic's in waiting, I usually swap out the original insoles at 100 miles or so. So with those and a little tighter lace, it is indeed a nice RIDE. The EVERUN is no joke either, fabulous response.
customer_reviews.author: Speegee

customer_reviews.title: Great Trainer!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these shoes. I noticed at first try on the shoe was somewhat narrow, but it has seemed to stretch out to a comfortable fit. I received them on a Friday, wore them all weekend as normal, and went for a 3 mile run on Monday. No problems! Excellent shoe and I'm becoming quite the Saucony fan. The shoe has just a tad more "pop" and firmness underfoot than the Ride 8, and is a great improvement in my opinion. The green is definitely vibrant. It's in the "running" as a choice for my marathon shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HOLE WITHIN 45 DAYS - JUNK SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I don't wear running shoes every day nor am I a runner, but these shoes developed a hole in the toe box within 45 days. Unbelievable. I have never had a pair of shoes so cheaply made that an actual hole develops within just over a month. I purchased in late May and didn't even have them to the end of June before the hole developed. Typically, I order shoes on Zappo's (owned by Amazon). This time, I thought I'd just order these directly on Amazon. Unfortunately, I think I'm out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: TreatMeRight

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Quality Isn't What It Used To Be.
customer_reviews.text: I've run in Saucony shoes since my first pair of Triumphs in 2007. I think I'm done. Less than 90 miles of usage, in the middle of a run, two treads completely separate from the mid-sole due to inadequate adhesive. I've requested a replacement or refund from Saucony, but haven't heard back yet. In addition, the laces on these are a bit too short and almost force me to overtighten in order to have enough lead to tie. My feet are even somewhat narrow! I've heard that Saucony's quality isn't what it used to be, and now I'd have to agree.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes that don’t last too long. I didn’t put a ton of miles on these before they fell apart. The soles started to peel and Saucony doesn’t respond when contacted. It’s unfortunate because they are a comfortable shoe. Maybe the newer versions are better. Save your money and get something up to date.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are, comfortable, and make for a good run. They are maybe a 1/2 size smaller than most, based on past reviews. I ordered a 1/2 size larger than normal and they fit perfectly. I remain skeptical, as Amazon had them for a great price, they arrived super quick, they fit as if custom made, they feel great running, and I even liked the color scheme... I don't have luck like this! I waiting for an email that states that they have a toxic dye that only reacts to MY foot sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Rafter A Cattle Co.

customer_reviews.title: Shorter, Narrower Toe Box--Plenty of Cushion
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony as my running shoe of choice for 30 years, since coming out of Tigers, along with ASICS. After returning to the Perregrin series for trail running, I bought the Ride 9 as a road trainer. The cushioning and relative stability do not disappoint, but a shorter than expected last with more narrow toe box than other models leave me wondering whether I can use the 8.5D US shoes over long distances of 20+ mikes to train. I'd have been better served sizing up to 9--something I found necessary in the HOKA ATR3 and Clifton 3 as well. My ASICS, Nike Flyknot Max and and Perregrin 6 and 7s fit true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Reformed Review

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing mine on May 17th to work. I ran about two miles in them and occasionally wore them to work. The grip started coming loose with in two weeks. Now 6 weeks later the grip is peeling off on both the left and right shoes. Avoid these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: They're very comfortable right out of the box and the toe box is a little wider then other running shoes I have but the soles didn't last long at all. Maybe 100 miles before the treads started falling off. I shoe gooed them back on but now the sole of one of them completely broke away and there is a huge hole. First pair of running shoes ive owned where the bottoms fell apart before the tops.
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: Sole is peeling off
customer_reviews.text: I have used these shoes probably 10 times and the sole is already peeling off. Unfortunately the return window was only 30 days so I am stuck with them. I will definitely think twice before buying running shoes here again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Plevyak

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and cushioned as to minmize the impact on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Saucony are the only brand of running shoes that I will run in. They are very comfortable and cushioned as to minmize the impact on my knees. I run on mainly soft surfaces (dirt, grass, treadmill) and I have been loyal to this brand for 20 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gautreau

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe that runs a little narrow.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great shoe. Excellent construction and design/aesthetics. The width on the wides is still a bit narrow for my foot. It's likely meant for the stronger ankles and better stride since it's made for running, but the shoe still manages to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL!
customer_reviews.text: these shoes have completely fallen apart with very little use! I’m unsure what happened, if these are legitimate or bootleg but the rubber tread has become undone. So upsetting
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M Davis

customer_reviews.title: Ride works for me
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Saucony Ride 7s, 8s, and 9s and I really like the model and consistency. It seems like they get about 600 to 800 miles before they start to go shot for me which is longer on average than most everything else I've run in. I would recommend going to a local running store to pick out your first pair and get everything fit properly but I've settled on the Ride and it always works out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I have had these less than a month and the traction is already falling off. My first experience with this sort of thing with the Saucony brand. Thankfully it isn’t too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco M.

customer_reviews.title: Great update
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Ride for me. Still fits really well and is one of the lightest, padded shoe that is great for distance running. Wear out is about normal, but this version has EverRun foam included (I believe that is new for the model). Really comfortable and lightweight. Great endurance runner.
customer_reviews.author: WhyNotTri

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable light shoe. Have not put too many miles on them yet but happy with the purchase. The bright orange is eye catching and was really happy with it as I run at night. Will update more as they get broken in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just does not feel as comfortable as the Saucony Men's Ride 10
customer_reviews.text: Just does not feel as comfortable as the Saucony Men's Ride 10. Less cushion and a different feel on the inside. I had run with the Ride 10 and took a step back to the Ride 9 and it was too much of a drop down. I now run with the Brookes Ghost 10 and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Olenski

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift for Friend
customer_reviews.text: I have a walking buddy and he needed new shoes. Saucony was the last shoes he had so I replaced them. They are a nice and fit good. The shoes are part of a fitness program - you have to have good shoes...
customer_reviews.author: Joce C.

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL CRAP - CHEAP FAKES!
customer_reviews.text: Crappy quality - doubt these are legit Saucony running shoes. Bottom treads BROKE/TORE OFF after just two months of indoor use. DON’T BUY - cheap knock-offs.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd pair fit great. Don't know why that is
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd pair of these shoes. Takes about 25-30 miles to break them in for me. My first pair were just a little loose fitting. My 2nd pair fit great. Don't know why that is. Got just over 200 miles on my first pair and have had no problems. I run 35-40 miles a week on average varies if I'm training for a marathon. I switch between these and Saucony iso triumph 2 every other run. I prefer the iso triumph 2 over these but the Ride 9 is a good shoe. Too bad they are getting harder to find in my size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok experience and smaller size than expected
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Ghosts same size these are smaller for my foot. I would have to go up a size. The toe box doesn't have as much room and in general the running experience wasn't as good compared to my previous Ghost 8. The cushioning didn't hold up as well for longer runs 10K+. The weight was nice, these compared better to Brooks Launch I have.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hildreth

customer_reviews.title: "Like" 👍
customer_reviews.text: Ride 6 heal finally wore out on me. Up graded to the 9. Feels very much like the 6. I hope it lasts as long. I'll let you know if it doesn't
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Men’s Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to replace his old, worn out pair of the same doe. He loves the neon orange color! He daid they are not quite as comfortable as his old pair that were a year older version, but still good enough for his morning runs.
customer_reviews.author: Dance4Joy

customer_reviews.title: Fit is different than the Ride 8
customer_reviews.text: I owned and ran in the Ride 8 for the past year and really liked them. I had put enough mileage on them though that I needed new running shoes. I decided to buy the Ride 9 in the same 10M size. Unfortunately, the fit is NOT the same. The newer Ride 9 is much narrower in the toe box. The middle toes on my left foot went numb on both of the runs I did in them (3 and 4 miles). I returned them and bought a pair of Ride 8's again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: These are not wide (EE) even though tag says they are.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is not a size 9 EE. This is my 3rd pair of Ride 9 in size 9 EE. I wore them for first time yesterday b/c I was storing them until my existing ones wore out. I put the new 9EE up against my existing 9EE (both are Saucony Ride 9 model) and these are much narrower. The tag says they are wides but they are not. I don't know if these are a manufacturing defect or if they are counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Saucony guy now
customer_reviews.text: It's my first time I bought shoes online hoping that I know my size of 11.5 2e. It was a $60 gamble. I also have never owned Saucony shoes. I've always been reebok, nb, or Adidas. When i put these shoes on my feet felt great. I'm a Sauc ony guy from now on. I hope they last because I've never felt a shoe that felt this good.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Please buy 1/2 number bigger for better fitment
customer_reviews.text: I usually use 10.5 for running, i went to Sportline and try this model , ask for a 10.5 it does not fit well So I bought it on Amazon.com, size 11, nice fitment, excellent price = )
customer_reviews.author: Skyline81

customer_reviews.title: My perfect running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I only run in Saucony's Ride shoe and will never use another brand again. This shoe fits me perfectly and regardless if I'm running long distances at a slower pace or short distances at a faster pace, this shoe never fails me.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Gold

customer_reviews.title: Great urban or suburban mid to long distance trainer
customer_reviews.text: Read about these shoes on a running blog. They were listed among the best general purpose running shoes and they do not disappoint. I got the 10 wide and they fit very well. Wide but not loose. Very nice length. Arch support is there but not over doing it. Personally, my arch is quite low profile but still there from a wet foot test. Excellent support overall to keep your knees happy running 3-5 miles on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the Ride series
customer_reviews.text: I love the Ride series...super comfy. I started out with a 10.5 in the Ride 5. The same size in the Ride 6 and 9 were a half size too small. Size 11 fits just fine. I'm an older runner so either my arches have fallen and my feet have gotten longer or the series 6 and beyond run a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Oertling

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good looking for bad feet.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my brother. He thought they were great from the moment he first walked in them. He is very difficult to fit. He was amazed he could wear them without discomfort and really thought they looked cool in black and red. He ended up getting a second pair. He is so happy with his new athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Margy

customer_reviews.title: Arch Savers!
customer_reviews.text: It works for my arch and plantar heels. The shoe is a little darker than the picture though.
customer_reviews.author: CoachM303

customer_reviews.title: so I knew they would fit comfortably..
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this particular shoe, so I knew they would fit comfortably... The thing I forgot was how comfortable they actually are. I run Approximately 5 miles a day, and my first pair wore out behind the heal after only 2 months. That was disappointing, but I pushed them as far as I could beyond that. They served me well, and being the most comfortable running shoe I've ever worn, I decided to give the Ride 9 a second chance. I'll report back after 300 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goodridge

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and a grind-it-out shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and a grind-it-out shoe. It's an everyday trainer. I would definitely buy his model again. The cushioning and heel are perfect and the forefoot is also cushioned. If you have a high to moderate arch and need support, this show will do it for you. The outside of the foot will take longer to wear out making the shoe last longer.
customer_reviews.author: MavsFan_11

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of Saucony running shoes about five years ago and I have never looked back. Saucony continues to produce exceptional shoes, both in style and in comfort. As someone with average sized foot length (9.5) but wide, it is often hard to find affordable shoes. These have met every expectation and more!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, love that orange glow
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit great and run great. Excellent color choice and good comfort, despite the technology possibly being out of date. This was one of my favorite Saucony shoes and I was super happy to find it at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Fit o.k., but shoes appeared worn.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit o.k. They appeared to have been either worn or tried on many times. Would probably not buy from this vendor again, as shoes were supposed to be new.
customer_reviews.author: Bullman

customer_reviews.title: Bloody toes oh no
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look cool enough. However, the right shoe is very rough where the tongue is sewn to the inner shoe. During my runs, this portion of the shoe tears my toes bloody. I am hoping the shoe stretches and this works itself out over time.
customer_reviews.author: Batty TN

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These fit the same as my Ride 8s. I switched to Rides because the Brookes PureFlows just wore out too fast and the Rides were recommended to me. They have a nice cushion. I am currently switching bwack and forth between Ride 8s and Ride 9s. They fit/ride pretty much the same (I run about 30-35 miles/week).
customer_reviews.author: Regular Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very good neutral gate shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great neutral gate shoe which I actually had previously as well. So far, one of the best pair of running shows I've had. Just enough coushining in the heal without babying your foot. Even reacts better than most shoes while making quick direction changes or sharper turns.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoe! I had originally bought these shoes a year ago in a running store for $125. After putting over 400miles on them I decided to buy another pair for when these finally give out.Just bought these on amazon for $65! That’s a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary C.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, great fit.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT SHOE and great fit. Keep buying he same models. They do fall apart after a lot of use, but that is the same for all these kinds of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: D. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Poor product. Soles started falling apart after only a few weeks of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Not that cushiony!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! The cushioning is so-so at best! When i run on the treadmill these shoes really make a clunking sound as the rubber is somewhat hard! Fine for walking, but I do not use them for running..which was my original intention!
customer_reviews.author: flames9

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Very nice running shoes but not in the rain. Water and mud tend to sneak in the fabric easily and your socks get wet almost immediately
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Out-of-the-box winner!
customer_reviews.text: The Ride 9 was an out-of-the-box winner. It fit just as I expected, was roomy enough in the toe box, and tight enough in the heel (my feet are fairly wedge-like). The cushioning was surprisingly plush, despite the minimalist design. Despite the lack of control features, the shoe performed reasonably well on grass and trails.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Speller

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The sole of the shoe began to come apart far than i expected it to. It's comfortable, and I still wear them. But the sole does catch on things...
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Overall great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes. The toe box is a bit small, but not overly tight. Length is true to size. Very comfortable to run in for short distances if you have wider feet. Really only thing that is a bit snug is the toe box area, other than that great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes, but the sole is peeling off the ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes, but the sole is peeling off the cushion. I find that this happens eventually with Sauconys, but this one went fast. It would be nice for it to stay together until I could wear the sole through.
customer_reviews.author: james wing

customer_reviews.title: Tread separated from sole, after less than 25 miles of use.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is disappointing garbage. The tread from the left shoe has completely split from the sole (photo attached), and I can see now that the right shoe's tread is starting to separate, too. I have owned these shoes for 6 days -- just long enough to have done three 3-mile runs and play soccer with my kid a couple times. Don't buy this. You'll regret it. I think a refund would be appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: halifamous

customer_reviews.title: Sole traction separating on right shoe
customer_reviews.text: Sole traction separating on right shoe after 3 months of light running. See photo. I've been using Saucony Men's Ride shoes for years. They have always been comfortable and very long lasting. This is a first and a disappointment. I don't see other reviewers with the same issue so hopefully mine is just a rare flaw. In fact, the left shoe is still in great shape. I've glued the traction back on with super glue and hopefully it will hold. I'm buying Ride 8 shoes to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: but still very good I run 3-4 times a week and my no ...
customer_reviews.text: I give 4 stars because a little narrow in front , but still very good I run 3-4 times a week and my no stress in my heels , very good for running
customer_reviews.author: yohannes tesfe

customer_reviews.title: I love the soft feel under my feel
customer_reviews.text: I love the soft feel under my feel. This is what I imagine the moon feel like! :) The only concern I have for future buyers is the metatarsal area is a little tighter, and when I run after a little bit, I can feel the tightness/comfortableness on the top of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday sneaker
customer_reviews.text: A little tight in the toe, but the shoes are very comfortable and are a very good everday shoe for me. I would recommend ordering a half size up with these shoes, as I tried them on in store and found them to be a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Running in clouds
customer_reviews.text: Love them, very good shoe. The first few runs the toe box was some what narrow but with time they expand. Another thing is that I have to tie them with the ankle not because they are kind of low profile in my ankles. Other than that they are fenomenal, you can even tell you are wearing shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney G.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reasonably durable.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Quite durable as well. I run about 35 miles a week and each pair of these last me about a year before I wear them down enough to start getting blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Logan N

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The fit of the shoe is fine however the tread is delaminating after only two months of light use (specifically the left shoe). Other purchasers have noted this quality defect and have provided pictures. Save your money and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MY favorite running shoe
customer_reviews.text: MY favorite running shoe. light and comfortable. Only downside is if you are heavy IM 185lbs, you may not have a ton of miles out of them, but I rotate a couple of them in.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sawaya

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love the Color. They fit as expected. They arrived quickly. They were exactly as they appeared on the web page. I am still breaking them in.
customer_reviews.author: MB Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite shoes. Comfortable and not as marshmallowy as the ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite shoes. Comfortable and not as marshmallowy as the Asic Cumulus 18 for example. Great for heavier walkers who need a good amount of cushion without going full on Hoka
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Paine

customer_reviews.title: Sizing smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Had to jump a half size to get a good width. Wide width not available. Use for everyday functions. Would buy again if size was available.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of shoes to break in for my upcoming marathon. I bought the Saucony ISO 2 and they were Terrible! I took another leap and tried these shoes and I'm certainly glad they worked out!! Love these shoes! I would buy them all!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wommack

customer_reviews.title: low quality sole.
customer_reviews.text: low quality sole, probably known defecit by the factory, but still they selling it as premium quality.
customer_reviews.author: Barak

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Saucony Ride Series is one of my favorites. Although there are several newer in the series, the deal on the Ride 9’s can’t be passed up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Support
customer_reviews.text: Walk 3 to 5 miles everyday my feet feel great!
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Issue with the sole wearing too soon.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes has an issue with the sole wearing out soon only with 3 months of running. I have seen similar comments from other people too so the manufacturer should consider providing a replacement for the people who have issue.
customer_reviews.author: Romit

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and performs well. I bought these for walking (my running days ended a few years ago). I'm now on my second pair and have no complaints whatsoever about them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My husband really likes this shoe and has run many ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes this shoe and has run many miles in his old pair. When I saw this come on special, it was a no-brainer to order. He was thrilled to have a new pair the same style as his old pair.
customer_reviews.author: E. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Saucony running shoes are durable and comfortable. This one seems to have been cut a ...
customer_reviews.text: Saucony running shoes are durable and comfortable. This one seems to have been cut a bit small, so I had to go up a half-size in order to get the right fit. I understand this model has been discontinued and replaced with the Ride-10. So, there are some good deals out there if you can find your size.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've run hundreds of miles in the shoes and they have held up great. Wonderful iteration of the Ride. I have a neutral gait and they are wonderful shoes. I wouldn't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Run small. When the size is right, the shoes are great.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have small toe box. First, I ordered size 9 (the size of Saucony Mirage 2 I used before) and it was too small. Then, I replaced it by size 9.5, which feels much better. Thanks to Amazon, replacing shoes was quick and easy. The new shoes perform great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Have been wearing Saucony ride for over two years after ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing Saucony ride for over two years after problems with forefoot when wearing Adidas (my previous long term shoe.) Immediate relief for pain in forefoot after making switch. Saucony do seem to wear quickly, about one year duration.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: I have been wearing Saucony Ride's for a few years ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Saucony Ride's for a few years and these arrived brand new and exactly as they would if I bought them from the store. What more is there to say?
customer_reviews.author: R. Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Great New Saucony Ride Series Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a regular user of the Saucony Ride series. I started wearing this type of shoes since Ride 3. This shoes have a good feeling, it can be noticed the difference with respect of the previous versions. For neutral type of runner feet, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: LVGJ

customer_reviews.title: Sizes run small
customer_reviews.text: The size runs too small. I bought size 10. I normally wear a size 9-1/2 but buy a half size bigger for my running shoes. My toes have no room. Tiny toe box. I’d return them but I already ran in them. Really bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair of these in a local store and wanted another so I came on amazon because I needed to save money if I could. It wasn't much cheaper, but I save around $20. Bought the exact same one as I already had, so it fits. It's a great shoe. The ever run foam insole is good.
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: Work great for running
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. Definately worth the price. Work great for running. I tried boxing in them and my feet slide around inside of them so I bought some mat shoes and kept these for running or walking and not as much lateral moving, pivoting or sliding of my feet. I've had them for a couple months now and they are still in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: sweeney

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe with good arch support, just runs a little narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are a bit narrow. My husband has a narrow foot but after wearing these shoes for a few hours he will take them off because they are a bit tight, he is hoping with wear they will stretch some. He says the arch support is good and he likes the cushioned insole.
customer_reviews.author: PineHills

customer_reviews.title: Tread fell off.
customer_reviews.text: Usually love Saucony, however this pair had the tread start peaking off after only 3 months of wear. We have only worn Saucony for our running shoes for almost 10 years. Not sure if it is just this style or a bad pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Kamille

customer_reviews.title: Switched to these and very pleased. The fit is different at the heel but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Ride 7's for several years. Switched to these and very pleased. The fit is different at the heel but comfort and weight is exceptional. I run about 40 miles per week and these are great.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought for the color to wear at Browns games and got exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Shahada

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are quite comfortable and have a lot of cushion. You just never know when you buy shoes online. In my case, size 12 would've been better than 11.5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable running shoe with good arch support
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped quickly and the shoe is really comfortable for me. Has great arch support and feels stable when running.
customer_reviews.author: Ddub

customer_reviews.title: My 18 year old loves the fit and support of ...
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old loves the fit and support of this model. This is his second pair in this style.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B. Greenman

customer_reviews.title: Saucony is the best running shoes I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is the best running shoes I've ever used, and I've used all of the major brands. The Ride is great for medium to long distance tempo running. I love the Kinvara for sprints and fast 5/10k's, and the Hurricane has been my go to all around run/cross/walk trainer. 5 stars all the way around!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good running shoe, you probably need to order 1/2 size to 1 size larger than normal though.
customer_reviews.author: mtodde

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for someone that needs the neutral type form shoe for running.
customer_reviews.text: Changed from Mizuno to these, very light and comfortable. A few runs to help break them in, but otherwise no complaints, I would buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ansky

customer_reviews.title: Tread falls off
customer_reviews.text: The orange tread pads did not stay attached to bottom of shoe Less than a hundred miles and unusable I really like saucony shoes and have bought many pairs of rides 3 7 and 9 I won’t buy ride 9 again
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Mann

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Run slightly small
customer_reviews.text: Had to go up one size. They were super comfy though and I ran all over the place in them. Got me through a half ironman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They run a full size small!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run a full size smaller! My husband usually wears a size 10, and the 10 were way too small!! We ordered the 11 and and they fit perfect!! Do yourself a favor and order them a size larger!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Callahan

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I wanted to receive.
customer_reviews.text: great price on relatively latest model. I would have purchased the Ride 10 but at almost half the price, i went with these.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Seems like an okay shoe but not true to size. My feel were killing me after running only about a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Tool

customer_reviews.title: Size is small; Runs smaller than the Ride 10
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Ride 10 and decided t try the Ride 9. TOO SMALL so had t send it back. I mistakenly assumed sizes were consistent between each edition of the Ride series.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Repeat purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I was really happy with the last pair of Ride 9. I got a ton 500 miles out of them. I typically only get 350 out of a pair of shoes based on my running style. (Road / Trail / speed work). Looking forward to them again!
customer_reviews.author: William Reed

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Ride 9 Pop Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The ride 9 is out of the lab and ready to run. Now featuring Everun, the ride 9 delivers our signature neutral running experience with more energy return than ever before. Everly is a dramatically more lively and responsive material positioned closer to the foot via top sole construction, providing smoother landings in the heel and reduced pressure in the forefoot. The ride 9 truly makes every mile feel as effortless as your first.
feature_bullets: Lace-up running shoe with padded tongue and collar featuring FlexFilm upper for lightweight flexible fit
EVERUN topsole construction for smoother heel landings and reduced forefoot pressure
